definition: to present to a superior/memorial/petition/to present (a certain appearance)/to assume (a shape)/to be (a certain color)
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request

sentences.english: The Petitioner had made or will make proper financial provision for the Respondent.
sentences.chinese: 呈请人已经或将会为答辩人提供妥当的经济援助。

sentences.english: Both the Petitioner and the Respondent are domiciled in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 呈请人和答辩人均以喷鼻港为居籍。

sentences.english: No other child now living has been born to the Petitioner during the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 呈请人在婚姻期间没有生下其它仍然在生的子女。

sentences.english: It must be pointed out that some questions have yet to be clarified.
sentences.chinese: 必须指出，有些问题还需要呈请。

sentences.english: But Mr Nazarbayev has turned down parliament’s petition.
sentences.chinese: 然而，纳扎尔巴耶夫拒绝了议会的呈请。

sentences.english: The rest of the petition follows below.
sentences.chinese: 呈请书的其余部分如下所示。

definition: to decide (in a meeting)/to resolve (i.e. pass a resolution)
to report, requesting approval/written request for instructions
to handle in accordance with (the rules)
imperial edict/see also 聖諭|圣谕[sheng4 yu4]
